name: Chef John's Blackberry Crisp
author: Chef John
summary: Actually any berry will work in this recipe (even frozen, if you must), but the dark, sweet blackberries are my favorite. Served barely warm, with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, it just doesn't get much better than this.
ingredients: 4 cups fresh blackberries, washed and drained well
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Pour in lemon juice; sprinkle sugar evenly over berries
Gently pat down berries with the back of a spoon and level the surface
Place rolled oats, flour, brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl
Mix together with a fork until mixture is blended and crumbly, about 1 minute
Distribute crisp mixture over the top of the berries and smooth out with a tip of a fork so all berries are covered
Bake in preheated oven until dark and berries are bubbling, about 45 minutes
Allow crisp to cool somewhat and firm up
